title: Matrices as Functions - solving a system

content.question:
<math alttext="A system of two equations. The first equation is 3 x minus 4 y equals 17. The second equation is 2 x minus 6 y equals 13."><mfenced close="" open="{"><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>17</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>13</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

The given system of equations can be rewritten equivalently as <math alttext="matrix A times vector v sub 1 equals vector v sub 2"><mi>A</mi><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover></math> , where <math alttext="A equals a 2 by 2 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 3, row 1 column 2 value negative 4, row 2 column 1 value 2, row 2 column 2 value negative 6"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>, <math alttext="vector v sub 1 equals a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value x, row 2 column 1 value y"><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>y</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>, and <math alttext="vector v sub 2 equals a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 17, row 2 column 1 value 13"><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>17</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>13</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>. Which of the following describes the product <math alttext="matrix A inverse times vector v sub 2"><msup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="matrix A inverse times vector v sub 2"><msup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector that gives the product of matrix <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> and vector <math alttext="vector v sub 2"><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover></math>.

<math alttext="matrix A inverse times vector v sub 2"><msup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector that contains the solutions to the system of equations.

<math alttext="matrix A inverse times vector v sub 2"><msup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector that gives the dilation of each of the components under the linear transformation <math alttext="L open parentheses vector v close parentheses equals A times vector v"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>.

<math alttext="matrix A inverse times vector v sub 2"><msup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector where the product of the components gives the dilation of regions under the linear transformation <math alttext="L open parentheses vector v close parentheses equals A times vector v"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="matrix A inverse times vector v sub 2"><msup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mover><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector that contains the solutions to the system of equations.
